author: gstein
msg: Introduce svn_wc_add_repos_file3() which is stream-based rather than
path-based. When a caller needs to use a path, then they learn too much
about the structure/implementation of the WC. With a stream, they can just
feed the function a stream from wherever they have the file (instead of
add_repos_file2() also took special files in normal form, but other files
in expanded form. add_repos_file3() now takes all files in normal form.
Note: yes, I've seen issue #2198. The overall cleanup will come later, but
I'm not focusing on that now.
(svn_wc_add_repos_file3): the new base contents are dropped into a
temporary file, later to be moved into place, and it is checksummed at
the same time. the contents are also dropped into the temp area, later
to be copied/translated into place (which handles both special files,
(svn_wc_add_repos_file2): open streams onto the given files, possibly
applying detranslating in the process. we need to use the given
properties to determine information about the file, since the target
path may not be version-controlled. after calling add_repos_file3(),
delete the files, per the API contract.
